sen.j: 寺田駅（てらだえき）は、京都府城陽市にある、近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Joyo City of Kyoto Prefecture, Terada Station is a stop on the Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation Line.
Located in Joyo City of Kyoto Prefecture, Terada Station is a stop on the Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation Line.
Located in Joyo City of Kyoto Prefecture, Terada Station is a stop on the Kyoto Line of the Kintetsu Corporation.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ駅。
sen.e: A station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.
The station has two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.
The station has two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.

sen.j: 改札・コンコースは地下に、ホームは地上に設けられている。
sen.e: Ticket gates and concourse are located underground and platforms above ground.
The ticket gates and concourse are located underground, and the platforms are above ground.
The ticket gates and concourse are located underground, and the platforms are above ground.

sen.j: ホーム有効長は6両。
sen.e: Platforms have an effective length to accommodate six cars.
Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.
Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.

sen.j: 駅入口は両ホーム側面の京都寄りにある。
sen.e: Entrances to the station are located on both sides of the platforms nearer Kyoto.
The station entrances are located on both sides of the platforms nearer to Kyoto.
The station entrances are located on both sides of the platforms nearer to Kyoto.

sen.j: 京都方面ホームに売店が営業していたが2007年10月に閉店した。
sen.e: The kiosk stall which had been doing business on the Kyoto bound platform closed down in October 2007.
The kiosk stall, which had been doing business on the Kyoto-bound platform, closed in October 2007.
The kiosk stall, which had been doing business on the Kyoto-bound platform, closed in October 2007.

sen.j: なお自動改札機は東芝製が設置されている。
sen.e: Automated ticket gates installed are of Toshiba manufacture.
The automated ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.
The automated ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.

sen.j: 赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: Red colored automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting and PiTaPa Card and ICOCA Card compatible.
The red-colored, automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting, and they're compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.
The red-colored, automated ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting, and they're compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.

sen.j: 急行の臨時停車
sen.e: Occasional stopping of express trains
Occasional express-train stops
Occasional express-train stops

sen.j: 駅最寄の文化パルク城陽でイベント開催時に急行が臨時停車することがある。
sen.e: Express trains occasionally stop at this station when an event is held at the nearby Bunka Parc Joyo (Joyo Cultural Center.)
Express trains occasionally stop at this station when an events are held at the nearby Bunka Parc Joyo (Joyo Cultural Center).
Express trains occasionally stop at this station when events are held at the nearby Bunka Parc Joyo (Joyo Cultural Center).

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization status
Usage status
Usage status

sen.j: 近接の西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）奈良線城陽駅が大幅に改良されて以降、利用客はJRに流れ気味である。
sen.e: Since the Joyo Station on JR-West's Nara Line in close proximity to this station made extensive improvements to its facilities, passengers seem to have rather drifted to JR-West.
Since the Joyo Station on JR-West's Nara Line, in close proximity to this station, made extensive improvements to its facilities, passengers seem to have drifted to JR-West.
Since the Joyo Station on JR West's Nara Line, which is close to this station, made extensive improvements to its facilities, passengers seem to have drifted to JR West.

sen.j: ちなみにJR城陽駅には全ての列車が停車するが、この寺田駅には実質的に優等列車が停車しない（準急は各駅停車区間にある）。
sen.e: Incidentally, all trains stop at the JR Joyo Station, but trains other than local trains virtually do not stop at this Terada Station (local express trains remain in between zones where local trains make stops.)
sen.cmt: “準急は各駅停車区間のある”の意味するところが判然としません。
sen.e: Incidentally, all trains stop at the JR Joyo Station, but trains other than local trains make practically no stops at this Terada Station (local express trains remain in between zones where local trains make stops).

Incidentally, all trains stop at the JR Joyo Station, but trains other than local trains make practically no stops at this Terada Station (semi-express trains make stops at the same stations as local trains in this zone).
sen.cmt: 準急はこの区間普通列車と同じ駅に止まる、と解釈しました。

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は9,910人。
sen.e: A survey conducted on Nov. 8, 2005 revealed that passengers who got on and off at this station numbered 9,910 on that day.
A survey conducted on November 8, 2005 revealed that 9,910 passengers got on and off at this station that day.
A survey conducted on November 8, 2005 revealed that 9,910 passengers got on and off at this station that day.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、75位。
sen.e: Ranked 75th amongst all stations (323 stations open on that day) subject to the survey.
It ranked seventy-fifth among all stations (323 stations open on that day) subject to the survey.
It ranked seventy-fifth among all stations (323 stations open on that day) subject to the survey.

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、13位。
sen.e: Ranked 13th amongst stations on the Kyoto Line (26 stations including Yamato-Saidaiji Station.)
It ranked thirteenth among stations on the Kyoto Line (a total of 26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It ranked thirteenth among stations on the Kyoto Line (a total of 26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、11位。
sen.e: Ranked 11th amongst (23) Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked eleventh among 23 Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked eleventh among 23 Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 城陽駅（JR西日本奈良線）……東に徒歩15分ほど。
sen.e: Joyo Station (JR-West Nara Line)…….approx.25 min. on foot to the east.

Joyo Station (JR West Nara Line): approximately 15 minutes eastward on foot
sen.cmt: JR Westとしました。15 minutes に修正しました。

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月3日 奈良電気鉄道桃山御陵前駅～西大寺（現・大和西大寺駅）間開通時に開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated on Nov. 3, 1928 when the section between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaji Station (now Yamato-Saidaiji Station) on Nara Electric Railway commenced operations.
It was inaugurated on November 3, 1928 when the section between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji Station (now Yamato-Saidaiji Station) on the Nara Electric Railway commenced operations.
November 3, 1928: The station was inaugurated when the section between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji Station (now Yamato-Saidaiji Station) on the Nara Electric Railway commenced operations.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 会社合併により近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Kintetsu Corporation station on Oct. 1, 1963 as a result of amalgamation.
It became a Kintetsu Corporation station on October 1, 1963, due to the amalgamation.
October 1, 1963: The station became a Kintetsu Corporation station as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: Use of PiTaPa Cards commenced on April 1, 2007.
PiTaPa card usage commenced on April 1, 2007.
April 1, 2007: The use of PiTaPa cards commenced.
